snippet: Paul Kazarian, a large investor in Greek bonds, is trying to convince others that the country’s debt is not as burdensome as it might appear.
abstract: Paul B Kazarian, one of the largest holders of Greek government bonds, has been engaged in all-out effort to convince investors and European government officials that Greece's debt load is not as dauntingly large as it appears, largely due to low interest rates; Kazarian is a mystery to others in world of Greek bond investors.
lead_paragraph: Paul Kazarian, a large investor in Greek bonds, is trying to convince others that the country’s debt is not as burdensome as it might appear.

headline.main: Greek Debt Vastly Overstated, Investor Tells the World
headline.print_headline: Greek Debt Vastly Overstated, Investor Tells the World
